I think the world's a better place with Saddam Hussein gone and with the Taliban gone and the al-Qaida out of Afghanistan, he added, insisting the President Bush administration's decision to invade Iraq in the wake of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks on the United States was "incremental," not rushed. Chief Executive Officer Steve Ballmer plans to extend a management shake-up aimed at adding senior product executives with an engineering background, two people with knowledge of the decision said," Dina Bass reports for Bloomberg. Changes may be announced this month, said one of the people, who declined to be named because the plans are private, Bass reports. "Last month, Steve Ballmer pushed out server division president and 23- year company veteran Bob Muglia, saying the company needed new leadership that could focus on areas such as cloud software."
